name: Comfort Suites at Sabino Canyon

reviews.text: Stayed at the Comfort Suites due to its location near a wedding we were attending. The room with one king size bed was clean, although slightly crowded. Access to the rooms was excellent, with each section having its own courtyard. The ambiance was wonderful. The courtyards were beautifully maintained and cool in the hot weather, with the flowing fountains and foliage. Did not use the pool, but it looked clean. The breakfast /brunch buffet in the lobby was excellent. We didn't want to leave.
reviews.title: Loved the Comfort Suites

reviews.text: Not luxurious, but a good place to stay for the money. Breakfast was good, room was clean. My only complaint is that there were no pots or pans in the kitchen cabinets.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: My wife had business to take care of in Tucson, so we decided to stay at the Comfort Suites at Sabino Canyon/Tanque Verde; I believe we paid about $75 for the night's stay.
reviews.title: Smoke stink leads to allergic reaction(s) !
Pick any other Hotel but thos One, PLEASE!!!!
reviews.text: The room, to start with, was very smelly, and we found, after some looking, that the smokey smell came from the air conditioning unit, which we had to have on, because it was still pretty hot out.
We burned some incense to kill the awful smoke smell, and that seemed to do the trick.
reviews.title: loved the architecture

reviews.text: Grimy, poorly maintained. Located in a strip mall off a busy highway.
reviews.title: A dump

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was located in close proximity to Sabino Canyon and Saguaro National Park. If you are going to Tucson to enjoy the outdoors this is within a short driving distance to some nice walking trails. The room was very secure. It had an extra deadbolt and chain. There was a nice continental breakfast with some extra hot items such as bacon and eggs. The staff was very friendly and the lady maintaining the breakfast area a cheerful attitude which adds to starting out the day with a good outlook. I stayed in a room that had a little refrigerator, coffee maker and microwave. The property seemed well maintained and the room I stayed in was very clean. The only concerns I had were minor. The beds were a little soft and the hotel is adjacent to a strip mall so that might be a drawback for some people. If you are traveling to Tucson and you will be having an active vacation in which you are looking for sights and outdoor experiences verses a spa vacation I would recommend this hotel. Check out my pictures to see the room.
reviews.title: Good value, nice location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the lobby, courtyard and pool areas are lovely, and the personnel pleasant and eager to please, this is not the Ritz. Our room, on the first floor was large and opened onto a mini-patio with high walls. The window opened onto that patio, so it was darkish. Microwave, mini-fridge, table and chairs, sofa, king bed, free local calls, all as advertised. It seemed strange that in a room this size,
reviews.title: Pretty Good

likes.disliked: — dark room, patio facing parking lot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the closet was less than 18 inches wide inside, but there were enough hangers. Despite the size of the room, it didn't feel relaxing, somehow. Mattress was adequate but not remarkable.
reviews.title: Stay here!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

likes.disliked: — The Selection Of Free Booz LOL There Are Only 3 Beers To Choose From

reviews.text: Still, for less than $100 at this time of year, we felt that we got a reasonable value for our money. It's an easy drive toward Mount Lemmon
reviews.title: Great for budget travelers
